html-has-lang:
The lang attribute can have any valid language code as its value. Some examples of valid language codes are:

- en (English)
- fr (French)
- es (Spanish)
- de (German)
- ja (Japanese)
- zh (Chinese)
- ar (Arabic)
- hi (Hindi)
- ru (Russian)
- pt (Portuguese)
- ko (Korean)
- it (Italian)
- nl (Dutch)
- pl (Polish)
- sv (Swedish)
- tr (Turkish)
- fi (Finnish)
- da (Danish)
- no (Norwegian)
- he (Hebrew)
- el (Greek)
- cs (Czech)
- hu (Hungarian)
- th (Thai)
- id (Indonesian)
- vi (Vietnamese)
- ro (Romanian)
- sk (Slovak)
- uk (Ukrainian)
- hr (Croatian)
- bg (Bulgarian)
- sl (Slovenian)
- lt (Lithuanian)
- lv (Latvian)
- et (Estonian)
- sr (Serbian)
- fa (Persian)
- bn (Bengali)
- ta (
